Are you referring to part of the translation of 
Torigoe Kazutar=F4: Tsuba =
Geijutsu K=F4, 2 vol, 144p+111P, Nihon Bunky=F4, Okayama, 1960. published b=
y the NCJSC as Tsuba:An Aesthetic Study? or to other notes?



David Zincav=
age



--------------------------------

This is the original, first editio=
n Japanese printing of the 'Nakamura Kakudaifu Nobuie Tsuba Shu' by Akiyama=
, Kyusaku, 1926, Tokyo, or, 'Collection of Rubbings of the Nobuie Sword Gua=
rds belonging to Nakamura'.  This is printed in the Japanese acordion folde=
d sewn binding style and is practically flawless with age related soiling t=
o the cover (see pic) with both cover fasteners intact.  The interior book =
is 'Fine'.  I have only seen two copies available in the last four years an=
d this is one.  The text is of course in Japanese but the rubbings are the =
primary source for study of the Shodai and Nidai Nobuie tsuba, not the late=
r reproductions.  I will be happy to include a transcription of the Haynes =
notes from his study with Dr. Torigoye as to the generation/etc. for each p=
age where noted in the Lundgren copy.  144 pgs. A most rare book.
